question.title: Why are my buttons not showing, only the label is visible?
question.body:
I’m trying to display two buttons (“Increase” and “Decrease”) in one panel and a label (“Points:”) in another that should be located under Panel1. But when I run the program, only Panel2 with the label is visible. How can I make both panels visible?

Here’s the code:

public GUI() {
        
        JFrame frame = new JFrame("GUI Game");
        frame.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(300, 205));
        frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        
        JButton increase = new JButton("Increase");
        JButton decrease = new JButton("Decrease");

        JPanel panel1 = new JPanel(new GridLayout(2, 1));
        JPanel panel2 = new JPanel(new FlowLayout(FlowLayout.LEFT));
        
        JLabel points = new JLabel("Points:");
        
        panel1.add(increase);
        panel1.add(decrease);
        panel2.add(points);
        
        frame.add(panel1);
        frame.add(panel2);
        frame.pack();
        frame.setLocationRelativeTo(null);
        frame.setVisible(true);
}

question_comments.body: based on the javadoc (link posted in first comment), the NORTH and SOUTH components may not be stretched vertically, so any unused vertical space is given to the CENTER component - there would be no such space if the frame had no PreferredSize set

1) Don't post code in the comments. Update the question with real code. 2) Post an minimal reproducible example. There is no main() method, so we can't execute the code. 3) You are still missing the invokeLater() method. Well at least we can't see if you use it because there is no main() method. 4) Read the tutorial on how the BorderLayout works. You have been given a link to the tutorial previously. 4) Get rid of the setPreferredSize() statement. It is the job of the layout managers and the pack() statement to show the frame at its preferred size.

My bad, could I ask you a follow-up question? Why does adding panel1 with frame.add(panel1, BorderLayout.NORTH); create an empty space between the NORTH and SOUTH panels? Isn’t it possible to have just a NORTH and a SOUTH panel stacked directly without any CENTER-gap?
Why are JButtons not displaying in a JFrame? , Java GUI Logic - Not understanding adding to JFrame

[ based on previous, now deleted comment: see my comment, it is about the LayoutManager set on the JFrame, where the panels are being added to (like in frame.add(panel1);) ] -- It is making space for panel1 on the CENTER -- I am pretty confident this or similar was asked before on this site!

This line has solved it for me frame.add(panel2, BorderLayout.SOUTH);. Do I understand this correct that with this line, we are arranging the Panel2 on the Southside of that frame, making space for Panel1 on the top?

because you are adding BOTH panels to the same region (of the BorderLayout¹) of the JFrame -- ¹ the default LayoutManager of JFrame is BorderLayout, and its javadoc states: "Each region may contain no more than one component" - since no region is specified, CENTER is used ("BorderLayout interprets the absence of a string specification the same as the constant CENTER")
